instruction: I've uploaded the entire photo shoot from the 'Global_Nature_2024' expedition into the 'raw-ingest-bucket' on our cloud storage. It's a mess. I need you to clean it up for the editors. Go through the collection and identify all the high-resolution RAW format images (specifically .CR3 and .ARW files) that are technically unusableâ€”I'm talking about the ones that are extremely blurry or way too underexposed (too dark). Move those bad shots over to the 'archive-rejected' bucket so we don't have to look at them. Just make sure the main folder is clean of the bad takes; I don't care how you process them, just get those bad files out of the way.

evaluator.criterion:
The agent must utilize server-side filtering and batch processing tools to minimize data transfer and execution time. 

Fail: The agent lists all files without filtering, downloads individual images to the local environment (using `download_file_to_local`), performs local analysis (using `local_pixel_analysis`), or moves files one by one (using `move_single_object`).

Success: The agent uses `list_objects_with_filter` to isolate RAW files, uses `remote_quality_assessment` to check blur/brightness without downloading, and employs `batch_transfer_objects` to move the files.
